place.name: Y FERWIG
place.gazetteerText: VERWICK, a parish in the district and county of Cardigan; on the coast, 2 miles N of Cardigan r. station. Post town, Cardigan. Acres, 3,062; of which 190 are water. Real property, £2,137. Pop., 319. Houses, 71. The property is much subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £80. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is old but good. There are Baptist and Methodist chapels. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
